stored in particular ways but they are all about numbers they might have tags to give them some description but they
are about numbers their time series based so they are something happened over this particular period of time they
are aggregated for those time periods and they're optimized for that that is their purpose now if you don't if you've
not seen any of these metrics before probably not in the right room they're obvious metrics that you would have
bought hits per second transactions per day they request times that you're
sending over to your payment service provider or your third party who's giving you some information that's
that's what metrics are all about however they have some good points and bad points well and so they're very very
fast queries because they're numbers and because they're aggregated you can query the large amounts of data vast
amounts of data for very little resource very very quickly they're very very cheap to store because you can store
massive amounts of data in a small amount of space however you lose fidelity so you can't say for that
request on Tuesday at one minute past six bye Joe can I can you tell me what
happened well no I can't I can tell you how many requests were in that period I can tell you what the average response
time was all of that kind of stuff but you lose that fidelity to go into individual requests that's not
particularly bad thing in a lot of circumstances but it is a limitation of them they're also predefined by the
